LetsURP

Movement Controls

Press the Arrowkeys to move. Press Z to Jump. Press Z again to Doublejump! Press Shift to Sprint.

View Controls

Press Up Arrow to Gaze Up. Press Down Arrow to Gaze down.

Grab a Ladder!

Up Arrow grabs a ladder, Jump or pressing down exits a ladder. Dexterity challenge! Try to jump from one ladder to another without touching the ground!

Dynamic Camera

High up on the poles, the camera turns into a wide scenic view. Try to climb the highest pole and gaze down!

Coyotetime

The player has two jumps, always. Try run off a cliff - still both jumps to use! This is called coyotetime. It makes movement more dynamic.

Game Making in the Unity Engine requires quite a bit of coding. This little practice project has 400 lines of C# code.

For example: here is the code for moving the player, checking if the player has movement, and activating the running animation at the appropriate time. 
        
myRigidbody.velocity = new Vector2(moveInput.x * runSpeed, myRigidbody.velocity.y);

isRunning = (Mathf.Abs(myRigidbody.velocity.x) > Mathf.Epsilon);

myAnimator.SetBool("isRunning", isRunning);
The PlayerScript can be seen in Github at: https://github.com/opafin

Made by opafin
